text: Who was the first Emperor of the Roman Empire? (Medium)
explanation: Augustus, originally named Octavian, became the first Roman Emperor in 27 BCE after defeating Mark Antony.

text: In which year did Christopher Columbus first reach the Americas? (Medium)
explanation: Columbus landed in the Americas, specifically the Caribbean, in 1492 during his first voyage.

text: Which event sparked the beginning of World War I? (Medium)
explanation: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary in 1914 triggered a chain of events leading to World War I.

text: Who led the Bolshevik Revolution in Russia in 1917? (Medium)
explanation: Vladimir Lenin was the leader of the Bolsheviks, who overthrew the Russian Provisional Government in 1917.

text: Which ancient civilization built the pyramids of Giza? (Medium)
explanation: The ancient Egyptians constructed the pyramids of Giza around 2630–2500 BCE as tombs for pharaohs.

text: What was the primary cause of the French Revolution (1789–1799)? (Hard)
explanation: Social inequalities, economic crises, and Enlightenment ideas fueled discontent with the monarchy, leading to the revolution.

text: Which treaty ended the Thirty Years’ War in 1648? (Hard)
explanation: The Peace of Westphalia, signed in 1648, ended the Thirty Years’ War and reshaped European political boundaries.

text: Who was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize? (Medium)
explanation: Marie Curie won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1903 and Chemistry in 1911 for her work on radioactivity.

text: Which empire was known as the 'Sick Man of Europe' in the 19th century? (Hard)
explanation: The Ottoman Empire was called the 'Sick Man of Europe' due to its declining power and territorial losses.

text: What was the main purpose of the Marshall Plan after World War II? (Medium)
explanation: The Marshall Plan (1948–1952) provided U.S. financial aid to rebuild Western European economies after World War II.

text: Which ancient Greek philosopher was the teacher of Alexander the Great? (Medium)
explanation: Aristotle tutored Alexander the Great, influencing his education in philosophy and science.

text: What was the primary cause of the American Civil War (1861–1865)? (Medium)
explanation: The main cause was disputes over slavery, particularly its expansion into new territories.

text: Which event marked the beginning of the Protestant Reformation? (Hard)
explanation: Martin Luther’s posting of the 95 Theses in 1517 challenged the Catholic Church’s practices, sparking the Reformation.

text: Who was the leader of the Indian independence movement against British rule? (Medium)
explanation: Mahatma Gandhi led the nonviolent resistance movement, achieving India’s independence in 1947.

text: Which dynasty ruled China during the construction of the Great Wall’s major sections? (Hard)
explanation: The Ming Dynasty (1368–1644) built most of the Great Wall’s surviving stone sections.

text: What was the name of the ship that carried the Pilgrims to America in 1620? (Medium)
explanation: The Mayflower carried the Pilgrims to what is now Massachusetts, establishing the Plymouth Colony.

text: Which battle in 1066 led to the Norman conquest of England? (Medium)
explanation: The Battle of Hastings in 1066 resulted in William the Conqueror’s victory and the Norman conquest.

text: What was the primary goal of the Crusades (11th–13th centuries)? (Medium)
explanation: The Crusades aimed to recapture Jerusalem and the Holy Land from Muslim control.

text: Which country was the first to grant women the right to vote? (Hard)
explanation: New Zealand granted women suffrage in 1893, the first country to do so.

text: Who was the Egyptian queen who allied with Mark Antony? (Medium)
explanation: Cleopatra VII allied with Mark Antony to strengthen Egypt’s position against Rome.

text: What was the main purpose of the League of Nations, established in 1920? (Hard)
explanation: The League of Nations was created to maintain world peace and prevent future global conflicts after World War I.

text: Which explorer circumnavigated the globe in 1519–1522? (Medium)
explanation: Ferdinand Magellan led the first expedition that circumnavigated the Earth, though he died during the journey.

text: What was the name of the 1215 English document limiting the king’s power? (Medium)
explanation: The Magna Carta, signed in 1215, established limits on royal authority and influenced modern constitutional law.

text: Which war was fought between Athens and Sparta from 431–404 BCE? (Hard)
explanation: The Peloponnesian War was fought between Athens and Sparta, ending with Sparta’s victory.

text: Who was the first president of the United States? (Medium)
explanation: George Washington served as the first U.S. president from 1789 to 1797.

text: Which event ended World War II in Europe? (Medium)
explanation: Germany’s surrender in May 1945, known as VE Day, marked the end of World War II in Europe.

text: Which Mesoamerican civilization is known for its stepped pyramids? (Hard)
explanation: The Maya civilization built stepped pyramids, such as those at Chichen Itza and Tikal.

text: What was the primary trade route connecting Europe and Asia in the Middle Ages? (Medium)
explanation: The Silk Road was a network of trade routes linking Europe, Asia, and Africa, used for centuries.

text: Who was the leader of Nazi Germany during World War II? (Medium)
explanation: Adolf Hitler was the dictator of Nazi Germany from 1933 to 1945, leading the country during World War II.

text: Which agreement in 1945 divided Germany into occupation zones? (Hard)
explanation: The Potsdam Agreement, signed in 1945, divided Germany into four zones controlled by the Allies.
